lines.content: Duke is a Command Line Interface application designed for desktop use.
2. Download the latest release as a JAR file from www.github.com/matheril/ip/releases.
3. Navigate to the directory where you downloaded the .jar to and run it with the command `java -jar`.
4. Run commands by typing them into the terminal and pressing enter.
The directory Duke is run from is referred to as `$DUKE`.
> `/by` `/at` - separate task description from their timings.
> `deadline` is a built-in command and will be displayed in lowercase in this documentation.
> `finish assignment` and `2022-06-03` are user-supplied parameters and will be displayed in UPPERCASE in this documentation.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Lists tasks in a readable format.
Here are the tasks in your list:
- `TASKINDEX` is the index of the task shown by `list`.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
- `TASKINDEX` is the index of the task shown by `list`.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Finds tasks with descriptions that match the supplied keyword.
- `KEYWORD` A keyword to search for. Tasks with `DESCRIPTION` containing `KEYWORD` are listed.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
- `TASKINDEX` is index of the task shown by `list`.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Exiting the program without using `bye` will not save tasks to the save file.
* Converts one line of user input into a Command subclass and returns it.
* Checks the String inputted by the user and executes the appropriate command
* @param nextLine The command to be executed.
public static Command parse(String nextLine) throws DukeException {
* Handles loading from and saving to the save file.
* Loads tasks saved in a save file, currently hardcoded to data/duke.txt.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if save file not found.
* @throws DukeException if a Duke error occurs.
private void loadSaveFile(String filePath) throws IOException, DukeException {
* Reads a single line from the save file and returns a Task representing it.
* @param nextLine The line to be read from the save file.
* @return A task representing a line from the save file.
* @throws DukeException if a Duke error occurs.
private static Task loadTask(String nextLine) throws DukeException {
* converts the shorthand Task char from a line in the save file to a class name.
* @param taskType a char representing the task type.
* @return a String representing the task type.
* Returns true if the task is marked complete in the save file and false if otherwise.
* @param isDone A char from the save file: 1 if the task is done, 0 if not.
* @return true if the task is done, false if not.
* Replaces the save file with the current list of tasks.
* @throws IOException if the save file cannot be written to.
* Fills the ToDo task component list with its description.
* @param task An arraylist that will be built into a task.
* @param pieces An array containing the '|' delimited chunks from a line of the save file.
* @throws DukeException if a Duke error occurs.
private static Task loadToDoDetails(ArrayList<String> task, String[] pieces) throws DukeException {

private static Task loadDeadlineDetails(ArrayList<String> task, String[] pieces) throws DukeException {

* Turns a task into a String that can be written to the save file.
* @param task The task to be converted.

* Stores a task in the list of tasks.
* @param pieces ArrayList<String> containing input from stdin. The first String in task should represent the type of
*                   Task that must be added to the list of Tasks. Supported tasks: todo, deadline, event
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + this.tasks.get(this.tasks.size() - 1));
* Constructs a subclass of Task from an ArrayList<String>.
* @param pieces the ArrayList<String> containing the user's input, split up by whitespace.
*                        The first element of this list should contain the subclass of task to be constructed.
* @return a subclass of Task determined by the first element of pieces.
public static Task buildTask(ArrayList<String> pieces) throws DukeException {
* Validates the input of the task to check for user error.
* @param taskType  the type of task (todo, deadline etc).
* @param taskList the list of components that form the task.
* @throws DukeException error message if task is invalid
private static void validateTask(String taskType, ArrayList<StringBuilder> taskList) throws DukeException {
* Splits an ArrayList<String> into an ArrayList<StringBuilder>, where each element
* can be used to construct a subclass of Task. Use this in conjunction with buildTask to construct a
* @param pieces ArrayList of Strings that represent the user's pieces split by whitespace.
* @return an ArrayList<StringBuilder> containing the pieces split by the '/' character.
* Each element represents a String used to construct the task.
* e.g.: deadline return book /by Sunday returns the following Arraylist:
* returns an empty list if pieces contains only a command.
* Prints all tasks stored in memory by addTask(Task) to stdout
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks the task selected by the user as done. Tasks are selected by their visual index on the list
* (starting from 1, not 0) and not by name.
* @param task The index of the task to be marked done.
System.out.println(("Task to be done is null."));
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks the task selected by the user as undone. Tasks are selected by their visual index on the list
* (starting from 1, not 0) and not by name.
* @param task The index of the task to be marked done.
System.out.println("Error: Task to be undone is null.");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Lists tasks containing the supplied keyword in the description.
* @param task String keyword to search for.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Deletes a task based on its visual index in the list.
* @param task Visual index in the list, starting from 1.
System.out.println(("Task to be done is null."));
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints 37 underscores to stdout to serve as a divider.
* Prints a greeting with divider lines.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");

* Parent class for all command classes.
* This class should not be instantiated.
* @param ui user interface to execute to.
* @param tasks task list to execute on.
* @param storage storage (save file) to execute on.
public abstract void execute(Ui ui, TaskList tasks, Storage storage);

* @return true if the program should exit.

* @param storage storage (save file) to execute on.
public void execute(Ui ui, TaskList tasks, Storage storage) {

* Stores deadline timing as a LocalDate object if format is valid or a regular String if otherwise.
* @param by Deadline timing either in YYYY-MM-DD format or any other format.
* Stores event timing as a LocalDate object if format is valid or a regular String if otherwise.

* Returns a String indicating if the task is done or not.
* @return "X" if task is done, " " if otherwise
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
